stanza.line: Two loves I have of comfort and (a)despair(/a)
Which like two spirits do suggest me (b)still(/b)
The better angel is a man right (a)fair(/a)
The worser spirit a woman coloured (b)ill(/b)
To win me soon to hell my female (c)evil(/c)
Tempteth my better angel from my (d)side(/d)
And would corrupt my saint to be a (c)devil(/c)
Wooing his purity with her foul (d)pride(/d)
And whether that my angel be turned (e)fiend(/e)
Suspect I may yet not directly (f)tell(/f)
But being both from me both to each (e)friend(/e)
I guess one angel in another's (f)hell(/f)
Yet this shall I ne'er know but live in (g)doubt(/g)
Till my bad angel fire my good one (g)out(/g)
